title: Explore upcoming Spring events and lectures at Archinect Partner Schools
author: Josh Niland
excerpt: The Spring 2025 academic term is unfolding, and that means it's time for us to take a look at some of the semester's can't-miss events, exhibitions, and lectures in store for our Archinect Partner Schools SCI-Arc, Pratt Institute, USC, Tulane University, UCLA, Temple University, the University of...
text: anchor The Spring 2025 academic term is unfolding, and that means it's time for us to take a look at some of the semester's can't-miss events, exhibitions, and lectures in store for our Archinect Partner Schools SCI-Arc, Pratt Institute, USC, Tulane University, UCLA, Temple University, the University of Oregon, Cranbrook Academy of Art, New York Institute of Technology, and Kansas State University. SCI-Arc Planet City by Liam Young, currently exhibited at SCI-Arc. DesignOther upcoming events include the TuSA Career Days 2025 event on February 12-14 and the Graduate Open House on April 3-4UCLA UCLA Architecture and Urban Design Spring '25 lecture poster, designed by Alyssa TohyamaLectures from popular architects Preston Scott Cohen (April 14) and Frederick Fisher (May 12) are among the term's highlights. Alums Kevin Sherrod (March 3), Todd Gannon (March 13), Mora Nabi and Sean Boyd (April 3), Miho Mazereeuw (April 7), Taylor Dover (April 21), Heather Roberge (May 1), and Aaron Cayer (June 2) round out the others. D'Silva (February 13), Porchia Moore (February 27), Mike Cloud (March 27), and Folayemi Wilson (April 10) highlight the Spring calendar Current student work is exhibited in 4D at Hatch Art until February 23 (don't miss the artist talk on the closing day at 3:30 pm)New York Institute of Technology Living in the Shade: NYCHA Open Space Past, Present, and FutureThe exhibition Living in the Shade: NYCHA Open Space Past, Present, and Future, co-curated by School of Architecture & Design professor Matthias Altwicker and Nicholas Dagen Bloom, is currently open to the public in the FXCollaborative gallery until February 27. Patterson of patterhn ives, LLC on February 24Andrew Rumbach, Senior Fellow at the Urban Institute, will deliver the series' final lecture on April 7For more events hosted by architecture schools, check out Archinect's academic events calendar here. html:
• anchor

    The Spring 2025 academic term is unfolding, and that means it's time for us to take a look at some of the semester's can't-miss events, exhibitions, and lectures in store for our Archinect Partner Schools SCI-Arc, Pratt Institute, USC, Tulane University, UCLA, Temple University, the University of Oregon, Cranbrook Academy of Art, New York Institute of Technology, and Kansas State University.

    SCI-Arc

    • Lectures lined up present Noah Barker (February 12), Doug Aitken (March 3), Rossana Hu (March 17), and Steven Holl (April 11)
    • The continuation of the Liam Young-led exhibition Views of Planet City includes a special panel discussion on February 14 with Angelica Lorenzi
    • Event-Cities 5: Poetics welcomes Bernard Tschumi for a book launch and conversation with dean Hernán Díaz Alonso
    • Also on display are the exhibitions Built Environment: An Alternative Guide to Japan (until February 26) and the upcoming show Dub Platforms (opening March 14)

    Pratt Institute

    • Toshiko Mori (March 6) and Xu Tiantian (April 1) are in store for the School of Architecture's Spring term schedule
    • A presentation of student work comes to Higgins Hall on February 13 with the opening of the exhibition Pratt Works: Pratt School of Architecture’s Bachelor of Architecture and Master of Architecture Recent Studio Projects
    • A special teach-in on Spaces of Solastalgia, Grief, and Loss will take place on February 28
    • The exhibition Transductions: Artificial Intelligence in Architectural Experimentation will be open to visitors until March 15 at Schafler Gallery

    USC

    • Lectures and presentations from Frances Anderton (February 12), Zhu Pei (February 14), Hadrian Predock (February 26), Frank Barkow (March 14), Yo Hakomori (March 26), Thomas Robinson (March 28) and Lori Ferriss (April 4) precede another timely one from Alison Hirsch of the Landscape Justice Initiative on the topic of 'Land, Labor, Liberated Futures in the ‘Other’ California' on April 9
    • Trojans should be sure not to miss the school's Firm Fair on February 21 or the Housing 10X symposium on April 11

    Tulane University

    • The school lectures series welcomes to campus Alan Karchmer and Robert Ivy (February 17), Morris Adjmi (February 24), Ann Forsyth (March 17), and Adam Marcus and Andrew Kudless (March 24)
    • The immersive exhibit What Matter's Here.?! will be on view until May at Tulane's Albert and Tina Small Center for Collaborative Design
    • Other upcoming events include the TuSA Career Days 2025 event on February 12-14 and the Graduate Open House on April 3-4

    UCLA

    Lectures from popular architects Preston Scott Cohen (April 14) and Frederick Fisher (May 12) are among the term's highlights. Alums Kevin Sherrod (March 3), Todd Gannon (March 13), Mora Nabi and Sean Boyd (April 3), Miho Mazereeuw (April 7), Taylor Dover (April 21), Heather Roberge (May 1), and Aaron Cayer (June 2) round out the others.

    Temple University

    • Adjunct professor Gabriela Cesarino will present on 'Scales of the Urban Experience in São Paulo' on February 12, followed by a lecture of alum Susan Jones on February 27. March presents 'Building Consensus, Recent Projects by KieranTimberlake' on March 19. Architect and historian Vanessa Grossman visits campus to give another of the School of Architecture's History Theory Talks on April 16
    • The 2025 Tyler Architecture & Environmental Design Career Fair takes place on February 11 this year

    University of Oregon

    • Upcoming School of Architecture and Environment lectures this Spring term feature Gene Sandoval (February 12), Ken Tadashi Oshima (February 25), and Achim Timmermann (March 3)
    • Currently open to the public until March 27, the exhibition City of Possibility: Portland Seen Through Architectural Models, Past, Present, and Future is a collaboration of UO College of Design with exhibit curators, PDX Design Collaborative, and other partners
    • The HOPES (Holistic Options for Planet Earth Sustainability) 30 Conference is taking place on April 10-12

    Cranbrook Academy of Art

    • Lectures from Leonor Hipólito (February 11), Carl J. D'Silva (February 13), Porchia Moore (February 27), Mike Cloud (March 27), and Folayemi Wilson (April 10) highlight the Spring calendar
    • Current student work is exhibited in 4D at Hatch Art until February 23 (don't miss the artist talk on the closing day at 3:30 pm)

    New York Institute of Technology

    The exhibition Living in the Shade: NYCHA Open Space Past, Present, and Future, co-curated by School of Architecture & Design professor Matthias Altwicker and Nicholas Dagen Bloom, is currently open to the public in the FXCollaborative gallery until February 27.

    Kansas State University

    • The Ekdahl Lecture Series features Hsin-Chun Wang of HCWD Studio on February 12, followed later by Anna B. Ives, Eric R. Hoffman, and Tony A. Patterson of patterhn ives, LLC on February 24
    • Andrew Rumbach, Senior Fellow at the Urban Institute, will deliver the series' final lecture on April 7

    For more events hosted by architecture schools, check out Archinect's academic events calendar here. If your school is hosting a lecture, open house, or any other type of exciting event, you can submit it directly here.

    Want to learn more about becoming an Archinect Partner School? Contact us here!
